 now fixed (#85).

short_description: Do you want to have a more 3D feeling of the blocks

description:
See a mob's HP, mob hostility, banner pattern icons, what tool can enchantments be used on, food hunger points, armor points, and much more!

Changelog
Changes and Additions:

Pack rebranding! Say hello to Item Info+.
The Hunger Points on Food Names section in Settings has been renamed.
There are now icons showing what tool/armor an enchantment can be applied to!
The designs of banner pattern icons have been changed! New design is by ChilRx.
The attack damage of a tool is now shown more clearly.
In British English, Cookies are now called Biscuits, and Baked Potatoes are now called Jacket Potatoes, to match Java Edition.
Spawn Eggs are now called (mob) Spawn Egg instead of Spawn (mob), to match Java Edition.
Added HP and Hostility information on the item name of Axolotl and Glow Squid Spawn Eggs.
Added Hunger information on the item name of Glow Berries.

Bug Fixes:

The default subpack is now Vanilla Style icons instead of Minecraft Earth Style icons.
The Bow item name is now once again translated in Korean.
The Fishing Rod item name is now once again translated in Norwegian Bokmål.
The maximum durability amount is now correct on Boots, Fishing Rods, and Carrots on a Stick.
The mob hostility icon now appears on the name of Fox Spawn Egg items again in American English.
short_description: More stats are now shown on item names, using simple and easy-to-understand icons!

description:
This pack will also be updated every time a new beta comes out to ensure a seamless experience in game whether you are on the betas or not! Through designing simple and faithful Ray Tracing textures Defined PBR creates an enhanced vanilla look for the game. Each block uses consistent materials so that they can all look uniform with each other.

Changelog 
 - Improved Lava and Flowing Lava materials
 - Updated to the new 21w15a stone ore textures
 - Improved Glow Lichen material
 - Added Chiseled Sandstone to Luminosity
 - Fixed all underwater fog issues in the Subtle and Cinematic Fog pack addons
 - Added PBR support for the Amethyst Block, Budding Amethyst, Small Amethyst Bud, Medium Amethyst Bud, Large Amethyst Bud, Amethyst Cluster, Calcite, Smooth Basalt, Tinted Glass, Raw Iron Block, Raw Copper Block, and the Raw Gold Block.
short_description: Defined PBR is a Ray Tracing compatible resource pack that combines simple but detailed heightmaps with subtle and consistent materials, leading to a faithful enhancement of the vanilla textures.

This pack does exactly what the title says. The amount of hunger points given for consuming a food item is now shown in the name of the food item! You can also choose for it to show the amount of time needed to eat it, armor points a piece of armor gives you, the maximum durability of an item, how much HP a mob has on its spawn egg and icons for banner patterns as well.
Changelog
The Hunger Points on Food Names section is no longer shown in Profile Settings.
The Hunger Points on Food Names panel is now a separate section from the rest of the settings! Massive thanks to NetherNinja for the help.
The additional amount of attack damage given from the Sharpness enchantment will now be shown on the enchantment name.
A new Legend section has been added in the Hunger Points on Food Names settings panel.
The order of sections in the Hunger Points on Food Names settings panel have been changed.
The Maximum Durability icon has been changed.
The Detailed Item Names mode now shows icons resembling the respective banner patterns on the banner pattern names.
short_description: The amount of hunger points given for consuming a food item (and optionally other stats) is now shown in the name of that item!

-Nylium, Mycelium, Podzol, Grass Path, Snowed Grass have new textures
-Golden pants have the right texture
-Guardians now have the right texture
-Chiselled blocks (except sandstone and quartz) have new brick textures
-The Bee Nest is as white as the Bee Hive
-The rain is white
The Mob Spawner is golden
-Bed items changed

Changed UUID for each pack so you can download new updates without having to delete the olds.
Updated textures of compass and clock to match with the new 1.17 java textures - Clear Vanilla (Default).
Added classic wool textures - Clear Vanilla (Classic) & Classic Texture Pack.
Removed the circle appears on mobile devices - Clear Vanilla Lite.
Pumpkin overlay transparency is now toggled by options in settings: classic = original, tweaked = 50% transparent, smooth = 100% transparent.
Red colors on sides of repeaters and comparators are now slightly brighter to match the redstone dust texture.
Added borders to wool blocks with an abillity to go back to original textures: classic = original, tweaked/smooth = wool with borders.
From now on, the links will be directly to MediaFire.

description:
This pack does exactly what the title says. The amount of hunger points given for consuming a food item is now shown in the name of the food item! You can also choose for it to show the amount of time needed to eat it, and also armor points a piece of armor gives you, and the full durability of an item as well.
There are 3 different modes available!

Go into Global Resources, activate the pack, and click on the cog next to the Deactivate button.

Changelog
-Changes and Additions

A new mode in Pack Settings Slider. You can now see the armor points an armor piece gives, and the full durability of an item.
"Hunger Points + Time Needed To Consume" mode has been renamed to "Hunger Points + Item Consuming Time".
The Hunger Bars in "Hunger Points Only" mode has been flipped to match those found in the hotbar.
Tweaked the texture of a Half Hunger Bar to match those found in normal Minecraft.
Tweaked the texture of the clock icon in item names.
New logo!
-Bug Fixes

Fixed parts of Traditional Chinese: Translation in Bedrock Edition is of Low Quality (MCPE-61166) (Minecraft Bug)
short_description: The amount of hunger points given for consuming a food item (and optionally other stats) is now shown in the name of that item!

Changelog

-Inventory tabs are now also transparent (Unfortunately this change also affects certain tabs on the title screen as the inventory tabs and world selection tabs use the same texture. There is not much I can do about this for now, sorry)

- New Panorama.

- Improved the pause screen.

- Fixed item names not appearing when hovered over an item in the custom inventory

description:
It is themed with blue-purple galaxy. It offers a variety of features such as unlocked V-Sync and Max Framerate Settings, Optifine textures and more. It comes with 3 built-in packs, one with 8×8 block textures to boost your FPS to the max.

Changelog
1. Start Screen
 - Made the buttons and the logo image a bit transparent.
 - Adjusted the name beside your gamerpic by 2px to the right.
 - Changed the panorama to midnight and purple midnight (for purple version)

2. Settings Screen
 - The perspective (F5) button is now found on settings instead on the accessibility options.
 - Added back the profile section and subpacks!

3. Hud Screen
 - Redesigned the coordinates text. (Credits: @Nezuko Chanヽ(✿ﾟ▽ﾟ)ノ✓ᵛᵉʳᶦᶠᶦᵉᵈ)
 - Removed the vignette renderer when you go to dark places (Fast)

4. Particles
 - Added back the particles since with or without them your game will still lag (if there are too many particles) Tested with 10 lingering potions.
 - Campfire particles are still gone.

5. UI
 - Remade and recolored some buttons.
 - Filled the entire dialogue atlas.

6. Rendering
- Removed fast grass (Source of lag, actually.)
- Added back the original clear water. (I didn't know how it got removed on V3 and V4...) (The old water was also a source of lag)
- Removed the HD sun and moon (Another source of lag, jeez, I thought these were gonna improve performance)

7. Subpacks
 - Added a purple version for Astral.
 - The default would be the midnight version.

description:
With this texture pack, you get high resolution quality records as well as an animated working turntable. This makes the game just a little bit more immersive.
I bring you the Quality Records Texture Pack. What does it do? This will make all the Minecraft music discs have 128×128 textures, making them 64 times more resolution. It also makes them look way more like a real life record.
short_description: It’s time to change the way you listen to the in-game records.

description:
Some people want to play Minecraft having an interface as if they were playing on a pc, although it is actually from the mobile device, they do not want the controls and other buttons to appear during the game, these can be hidden using a gamepad or keyboard and mouse. But if you don’t have one of these things, it’s easier to use a texture that hides these buttons.

Changelog
- Now the plugin adjusts to the language of the game (for now there will only be Spanish and English)
- Emotes button is now invisible
short_description: What this little add-on does is make the touch controls, the inventory button, and the chat and pause buttons completely invisible
